anvil.api.Internal

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • anvil.api.Internal.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a Minecraft Player.

    The Player class communicates with Mojang's player-base servers to get related UUIDs and userNames. Each Player is cached in the wrapper and is only stored in memory (restarting the wrapper clears the cache). A Player is cached every time it interacts with the server for the first time every run-through. Command-Block "Players" are included in this list and have userName "@" and the UUID [null].

    Because of the connection to Mojang's player-base servers, the wrapper only works with an Internet connection.

    Cached Players are dubbed as known Players.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Garrett Stonis

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String userName)
       throws java.io.IOException,
              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a Player object with a given userName.

        If the Player is known, this object is a copy of the known object.

        Parameters:
        userName - String object containing the userName of the Player.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the wrapper cannot connect to Mojang's Servers.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the userName isn't a legal userName, or when Mojang's servers don't recognize it as a known Player.

      • Player

        public Player(java.util.UUID uuid)
       throws java.io.IOException,
              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a Player object with a given UUID.

        If the Player is known, this object is a copy of the known object.

        Parameters:
        uuid - UUID object containing the UUID of the Player.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the wrapper cannot connect to Mojang's Servers.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When Mojang's servers don't recognize the given UUID as an existing Player.

      • setOp

        public boolean setOp(java.lang.String tag,
                     boolean value,
                     int level,
                     boolean bypass)
        Sets the op status of this Player to the given value in the Runner of the given tag. level and bypass can't be specified in-game because of command restrictions. They will take effect after the Minecraft server is restarted.

        If the in-game equivalent of these commands take-place, the ServerOutputLine parser will handle it.

        Parameters:
        tag - String object containing the tag of the Runner to change the op status of.
        value - Boolean representing what value to change the Player's op status to.
        level - Integer representing the op level of the Player. Ignored if value is false.
        bypass - Boolean representing whether or not the Player can bypass the Minecraft server's player limit. Ignored if value is false.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the set was successful.

      • setOp

        public boolean setOp(java.lang.String tag,
                     boolean value)
        Sets the op status of this Player to the given value in the Runner of the given tag. level and bypass will be the default values, as specified in the properties file.

        If the in-game equivalent of these commands take-place, the ServerOutputLine parser will handle it.

        Parameters:
        tag - String object containing the tag of the Runner to change the op status of.
        value - Boolean representing what value to change the Player's op status to.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the set was successful.

      • setBan

        public boolean setBan(java.lang.String tag,
                      boolean value,
                      java.lang.String banMessage)
        Sets the ban status of this Player to the given value in the Runner of the given tag. Uses the given ban message.

        If the in-game equivalent of these commands take-place, the ServerOutputLine parser will handle it.

        Parameters:
        tag - String object containing the tag of the Runner to change the ban status of.
        value - Boolean representing what value to change the Player's ban status to.
        banMessage - String object containing the ban message (reason the Player was banned). If null or empty, the default ban message will be used. If value is false, this field is ignored.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the set was successful.

      • setBan

        public boolean setBan(java.lang.String tag,
                      boolean value)
        Sets the ban status of this Player to the given value in the Runner of the given tag. Uses the default ban message.

        If the in-game equivalent of these commands take-place, the ServerOutputLine parser will handle it.

        Parameters:
        tag - String object containing the tag of the Runner to change the ban status of.
        value - Boolean representing what value to change the Player's ban status to.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the set was successful.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Tells whether or not the given Player object is equal to this Player object.

        They will only be equal if the userName and UUID of each object is equal. All command block "Players" are considered equal.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - The other Player to check for equality.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the given Player object is equal to this Player object.

        Gets the userName of the Player as a String object.

        Equivalent to getUserName().

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String object containing the userName of the Player.
